parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To stand fast, stand firm, persevere. From the perfect tense of histemi; to be stationary, i.e. to persevere.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
